summary: This bill, the First-Time Parents Tax Credit Act, proposes a refundable tax credit for first-time parents. The credit is $1,250 per eligible new parent, or $2,500 for those filing jointly. An eligible new parent is defined as someone who hasn't claimed the credit before and is either the parent of a qualifying child born or adopted during the taxable year, or the non-custodial parent of a child born or adopted in the preceding year. The bill also includes conforming amendments to the Internal Revenue Code and specifies an effective date of taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
